div.p: THe countries of Europe, as we now call them are Spaine, France, Germaine, Italie, Slauonia, Grzce, Hungary, Polonia, Lituauia, Mofcouie, or more Å¿ignificatly the countrie of Sarmatia, and the PeninÅ¿ula in which is Norwey, Sweden, and Gothland. Among the lies, Albion, conteyning England & Scotland is the chiefeÅ¿t, next vnto it haue ye Ireland, then more northerly is IÅ¿land, FriÅ¿land, & laÅ¿tly Groonland, all in the Ocean Å¿ea.In the Mediteraneum Å¿ea it hath Sicilia, Sardinia, Corfica, Candie, Maiorica, Minorica, Gorphum, Nigropont, and others of leÅ¿Å¿e fame, whoÅ¿e Å¿eueral names, and Å¿ituations do appeere in the Mappe. This our Europe (beÅ¿ides for the Romaine Empier) honorable throughout all the world hath aboue 28 ChriÅ¿tian Kingdoms, yf you adde the 14. Which Å¿ome recon only in Spaine. It is paÅ¿Å¿ing fertil, naturally temperate, and of a milde aier. And inferior to no other parte in plentie of all kinde of fruitfruit, wynewine, and plantsvariation of plants, but to be compared with the moÅ¿t excellent, beeing made pleaÅ¿ant with moÅ¿t faire Citties, Villages and Throughfares. And although it be in compas leÅ¿Å¿er then the other, yet for the woorthineÅ¿Å¿e of the people it is preferred before all other partes of the world, & euer hath bin by all auncient writers, hauing both for the Empier of the Macedonians and mightyneÅ¿Å¿e of the Romaines bin moÅ¿te renowmed.Â

Ortelius, Abraham, 1527-1598. An epitome of Ortelius his Theater of the vvorld, vvherein the principal regions of the earth are descrived in smalle mappes. VVith a brief declaration annexed to ech mappe. And donne in more exact manner, then lyke declarations in Latin, French, or other languages. It is also amplyfied with new mappes wanting in the Latin editions. Antwerp: Iohn Norton, 1601. STC 18857. ProQuest, https://www.proquest.com/books/epitome-ortelius-his-theater-vvorld-vvherein/docview/2240904399/se-2.Â
